intro: Lysimachia verna, commonly known as spring woundwort, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters and features bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Lysimachia verna is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported healing properties.
